stance_1: I believe meat is healthy and high in protein
stance_2: I enjoy the taste of meat
justification: Enjoying the taste of meat and believing it is healthy both support the continued inclusion of meat in meals.

stance_1: I believe meat is healthy and high in protein
stance_2: I grew up eating meat with every meal
justification: A family tradition of eating meat with every meal may reinforce the belief that meat is healthy.

stance_1: I believe meat is healthy and high in protein
justification: The belief that meat is healthy directly supports the behavior of including meat in most meals.

stance_1: I believe meat is healthy and high in protein
stance_2: I have health motivations to change my meat consumption
justification: The belief in meat's healthfulness is a motivation for choosing and adjusting meat consumption for health reasons.

stance_1: I changed to eating more chicken and fish
stance_2: I have health motivations to change my meat consumption
justification: The interviewee explicitly states health motivations for changing to more chicken and fish.

stance_1: I changed to eating more chicken and fish
stance_2: I reduced beef and stopped eating pork for health
justification: Changing meat types and reducing beef/pork are both described as health-driven dietary changes.

stance_1: I changed to eating more chicken and fish
justification: The change to eating more chicken and fish is a modification within the broader pattern of generally including meat in meals.

stance_1: I enjoy the taste of meat
justification: Enjoying the taste of meat is explicitly stated as a reason for including meat in most meals.

stance_1: I grew up eating meat with every meal
justification: The interviewee explicitly links childhood family habits to their current routine of including meat in meals.

stance_1: I grew up eating meat with every meal
stance_2: I enjoy the taste of meat
justification: Growing up eating meat may contribute to enjoying its taste, though this is not directly stated.

stance_1: I have health motivations to change my meat consumption
stance_2: I reduced beef and stopped eating pork for health
justification: Health motivation is the explicit reason for reducing beef and avoiding pork.

stance_1: I have health motivations to change my meat consumption
stance_2: My mother avoids pork for health reasons
justification: The interviewee's health motivations and their mother's avoidance of pork for health reasons are thematically connected.

stance_1: I have health motivations to change my meat consumption
stance_2: Social contacts are motivated by health concerns
justification: Family and friends' health-related motivations for meat choices mirror the interviewee's own motivations.

stance_1: My mother avoids pork for health reasons
stance_2: Social contacts are motivated by health concerns
justification: Mother's avoidance of pork is a specific example of social contacts being motivated by health concerns.
